Browse the source code of codebrowser/source/externals/clhep/include/CLHEP/Vector/LorentzVector.h

1// -*- C++ -*-
2// CLASSDOC OFF
3// ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
4// CLASSDOC ON
5//
6// This file is a part of the CLHEP - a Class Library for High Energy Physics.
7//
8// HepLorentzVector is a Lorentz vector consisting of Hep3Vector and
9// double components. Lorentz transformations (rotations and boosts)
10// of these vectors are perfomed by multiplying with objects of
11// the HepLorenzRotation class.
12//
13// .SS See Also
14// ThreeVector.h, Rotation.h, LorentzRotation.h
15//
16// .SS Authors
17// Leif Lonnblad and Anders Nilsson. Modified by Evgueni Tcherniaev, Mark Fischler
18//
19
20#ifndef HEP_LORENTZVECTOR_H
21#define HEP_LORENTZVECTOR_H
22
23#ifdef GNUPRAGMA
24#pragma interface
25#endif
26
27#include <iostream>
28#include "CLHEP/Vector/ThreeVector.h"
29
30namespace CLHEP {
31
32// Declarations of classes and global methods
33class HepLorentzVector;
34class HepLorentzRotation;
35class HepRotation;
36class HepAxisAngle;
37class HepEulerAngles;
38class Tcomponent;
39HepLorentzVector rotationXOf( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double delta );
40HepLorentzVector rotationYOf( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double delta );
41HepLorentzVector rotationZOf( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double delta );
42HepLorentzVector rotationOf
43 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const Hep3Vector & axis, double delta );
44HepLorentzVector rotationOf
45 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const HepAxisAngle & ax );
46HepLorentzVector rotationOf
47 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const HepEulerAngles & e );
48HepLorentzVector rotationOf
49 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double phi,
50 double theta,
51 double psi );
52inline
53HepLorentzVector boostXOf( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double beta );
54inline
55HepLorentzVector boostYOf( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double beta );
56inline
57HepLorentzVector boostZOf( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double beta );
58inline HepLorentzVector boostOf
59 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const Hep3Vector & betaVector );
60inline HepLorentzVector boostOf
61 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const Hep3Vector & axis, double beta );
62
63enum ZMpvMetric_t { TimePositive, TimeNegative };
64
65
66/**
67 * @author
68 * @ingroup vector
69 */
70
71class HepLorentzVector {
72
73public:
74
75 enum { X=0, Y=1, Z=2, T=3, NUM_COORDINATES=4, SIZE=NUM_COORDINATES };
76 // Safe indexing of the coordinates when using with matrices, arrays, etc.
77 // (BaBar)
78
79 inline HepLorentzVector(double x, double y,
80 double z, double t);
81 // Constructor giving the components x, y, z, t.
82
83 inline HepLorentzVector(double x, double y, double z);
84 // Constructor giving the components x, y, z with t-component set to 0.0.
85
86 explicit HepLorentzVector(double t);
87 // Constructor giving the t-component with x, y and z set to 0.0.
88
89 inline HepLorentzVector();
90 // Default constructor with x, y, z and t set to 0.0.
91
92 inline HepLorentzVector(const Hep3Vector & p, double e);
93 inline HepLorentzVector(double e, const Hep3Vector & p);
94 // Constructor giving a 3-Vector and a time component.
95
96 inline HepLorentzVector(const HepLorentzVector &);
97 // Copy constructor.
98
99 inline ~HepLorentzVector();
100 // The destructor.
101
102 inline operator const Hep3Vector & () const;
103 inline operator Hep3Vector & ();
104 // Conversion (cast) to Hep3Vector.
105
106 inline double x() const;
107 inline double y() const;
108 inline double z() const;
109 inline double t() const;
110 // Get position and time.
111
112 inline void setX(double);
113 inline void setY(double);
114 inline void setZ(double);
115 inline void setT(double);
116 // Set position and time.
117
118 inline double px() const;
119 inline double py() const;
120 inline double pz() const;
121 inline double e() const;
122 // Get momentum and energy.
123
124 inline void setPx(double);
125 inline void setPy(double);
126 inline void setPz(double);
127 inline void setE(double);
128 // Set momentum and energy.
129
130 inline Hep3Vector vect() const;
131 // Get spatial component.
132
133 inline void setVect(const Hep3Vector &);
134 // Set spatial component.
135
136 inline double theta() const;
137 inline double cosTheta() const;
138 inline double phi() const;
139 inline double rho() const;
140 // Get spatial vector components in spherical coordinate system.
141
142 inline void setTheta(double);
143 inline void setPhi(double);
144 inline void setRho(double);
145 // Set spatial vector components in spherical coordinate system.
146
147 double operator () (int) const;
148 inline double operator [] (int) const;
149 // Get components by index.
150
151 double & operator () (int);
152 inline double & operator [] (int);
153 // Set components by index.
154
155 inline HepLorentzVector & operator = (const HepLorentzVector &);
156 // Assignment.
157
158 inline HepLorentzVector operator + (const HepLorentzVector &) const;
159 inline HepLorentzVector & operator += (const HepLorentzVector &);
160 // Additions.
161
162 inline HepLorentzVector operator - (const HepLorentzVector &) const;
163 inline HepLorentzVector & operator -= (const HepLorentzVector &);
164 // Subtractions.
165
166 inline HepLorentzVector operator - () const;
167 // Unary minus.
168
169 inline HepLorentzVector & operator *= (double);
170 HepLorentzVector & operator /= (double);
171 // Scaling with real numbers.
172
173 inline bool operator == (const HepLorentzVector &) const;
174 inline bool operator != (const HepLorentzVector &) const;
175 // Comparisons.
176
177 inline double perp2() const;
178 // Transverse component of the spatial vector squared.
179
180 inline double perp() const;
181 // Transverse component of the spatial vector (R in cylindrical system).
182
183 inline void setPerp(double);
184 // Set the transverse component of the spatial vector.
185
186 inline double perp2(const Hep3Vector &) const;
187 // Transverse component of the spatial vector w.r.t. given axis squared.
188
189 inline double perp(const Hep3Vector &) const;
190 // Transverse component of the spatial vector w.r.t. given axis.
191
192 inline double angle(const Hep3Vector &) const;
193 // Angle wrt. another vector.
194
195 inline double mag2() const;
196 // Dot product of 4-vector with itself.
197 // By default the metric is TimePositive, and mag2() is the same as m2().
198
199 inline double m2() const;
200 // Invariant mass squared.
201
202 inline double mag() const;
203 inline double m() const;
204 // Invariant mass. If m2() is negative then -sqrt(-m2()) is returned.
205
206 inline double mt2() const;
207 // Transverse mass squared.
208
209 inline double mt() const;
210 // Transverse mass.
211
212 inline double et2() const;
213 // Transverse energy squared.
214
215 inline double et() const;
216 // Transverse energy.
217
218 inline double dot(const HepLorentzVector &) const;
219 inline double operator * (const HepLorentzVector &) const;
220 // Scalar product.
221
222 inline double invariantMass2( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
223 // Invariant mass squared of pair of 4-vectors
224
225 double invariantMass ( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
226 // Invariant mass of pair of 4-vectors
227
228 inline void setVectMag(const Hep3Vector & spatial, double magnitude);
229 inline void setVectM(const Hep3Vector & spatial, double mass);
230 // Copy spatial coordinates, and set energy = sqrt(mass^2 + spatial^2)
231
232 inline double plus() const;
233 inline double minus() const;
234 // Returns the positive/negative light-cone component t +/- z.
235
236 Hep3Vector boostVector() const;
237 // Boost needed from rest4Vector in rest frame to form this 4-vector
238 // Returns the spatial components divided by the time component.
239
240 HepLorentzVector & boost(double, double, double);
241 inline HepLorentzVector & boost(const Hep3Vector &);
242 // Lorentz boost.
243
244 HepLorentzVector & boostX( double beta );
245 HepLorentzVector & boostY( double beta );
246 HepLorentzVector & boostZ( double beta );
247 // Boost along an axis, by magnitue beta (fraction of speed of light)
248
249 double rapidity() const;
250 // Returns the rapidity, i.e. 0.5*ln((E+pz)/(E-pz))
251
252 inline double pseudoRapidity() const;
253 // Returns the pseudo-rapidity, i.e. -ln(tan(theta/2))
254
255 inline bool isTimelike() const;
256 // Test if the 4-vector is timelike
257
258 inline bool isSpacelike() const;
259 // Test if the 4-vector is spacelike
260
261 inline bool isLightlike(double epsilon=tolerance) const;
262 // Test for lightlike is within tolerance epsilon
263
264 HepLorentzVector & rotateX(double);
265 // Rotate the spatial component around the x-axis.
266
267 HepLorentzVector & rotateY(double);
268 // Rotate the spatial component around the y-axis.
269
270 HepLorentzVector & rotateZ(double);
271 // Rotate the spatial component around the z-axis.
272
273 HepLorentzVector & rotateUz(const Hep3Vector &);
274 // Rotates the reference frame from Uz to newUz (unit vector).
275
276 HepLorentzVector & rotate(double, const Hep3Vector &);
277 // Rotate the spatial component around specified axis.
278
279 inline HepLorentzVector & operator *= (const HepRotation &);
280 inline HepLorentzVector & transform(const HepRotation &);
281 // Transformation with HepRotation.
282
283 HepLorentzVector & operator *= (const HepLorentzRotation &);
284 HepLorentzVector & transform(const HepLorentzRotation &);
285 // Transformation with HepLorenzRotation.
286
287// = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
288//
289// Esoteric properties and operations on 4-vectors:
290//
291// 0 - Flexible metric convention and axial unit 4-vectors
292// 1 - Construct and set 4-vectors in various ways
293// 2 - Synonyms for accessing coordinates and properties
294// 2a - Setting space coordinates in different ways
295// 3 - Comparisions (dictionary, near-ness, and geometric)
296// 4 - Intrinsic properties
297// 4a - Releativistic kinematic properties
298// 4b - Methods combining two 4-vectors
299// 5 - Properties releative to z axis and to arbitrary directions
300// 7 - Rotations and Boosts
301//
302// = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
303
304// 0 - Flexible metric convention
305
306 static ZMpvMetric_t setMetric( ZMpvMetric_t met );
307 static ZMpvMetric_t getMetric();
308
309// 1 - Construct and set 4-vectors in various ways
310
311 inline void set (double x, double y, double z, double t);
312 inline void set (double x, double y, double z, Tcomponent t);
313 inline HepLorentzVector(double x, double y, double z, Tcomponent t);
314 // Form 4-vector by supplying cartesian coordinate components
315
316 inline void set (Tcomponent t, double x, double y, double z);
317 inline HepLorentzVector(Tcomponent t, double x, double y, double z);
318 // Deprecated because the 4-doubles form uses x,y,z,t, not t,x,y,z.
319
320 inline void set ( double t );
321
322 inline void set ( Tcomponent t );
323 inline explicit HepLorentzVector( Tcomponent t );
324 // Form 4-vector with zero space components, by supplying t component
325
326 inline void set ( const Hep3Vector & v );
327 inline explicit HepLorentzVector( const Hep3Vector & v );
328 // Form 4-vector with zero time component, by supplying space 3-vector
329
330 inline HepLorentzVector & operator=( const Hep3Vector & v );
331 // Form 4-vector with zero time component, equal to space 3-vector
332
333 inline void set ( const Hep3Vector & v, double t );
334 inline void set ( double t, const Hep3Vector & v );
335 // Set using specified space vector and time component
336
337// 2 - Synonyms for accessing coordinates and properties
338
339 inline double getX() const;
340 inline double getY() const;
341 inline double getZ() const;
342 inline double getT() const;
343 // Get position and time.
344
345 inline Hep3Vector v() const;
346 inline Hep3Vector getV() const;
347 // Get spatial component. Same as vect.
348
349 inline void setV(const Hep3Vector &);
350 // Set spatial component. Same as setVect.
351
352// 2a - Setting space coordinates in different ways
353
354 inline void setV( double x, double y, double z );
355
356 inline void setRThetaPhi( double r, double theta, double phi);
357 inline void setREtaPhi( double r, double eta, double phi);
358 inline void setRhoPhiZ( double rho, double phi, double z );
359
360// 3 - Comparisions (dictionary, near-ness, and geometric)
361
362 int compare( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
363
364 bool operator >( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
365 bool operator <( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
366 bool operator>=( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
367 bool operator<=( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
368
369 bool isNear ( const HepLorentzVector & w,
370 double epsilon=tolerance ) const;
371 double howNear( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
372 // Is near using Euclidean measure t**2 + v**2
373
374 bool isNearCM ( const HepLorentzVector & w,
375 double epsilon=tolerance ) const;
376 double howNearCM( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
377 // Is near in CM frame: Applicable only for two timelike HepLorentzVectors
378
379 // If w1 and w2 are already in their CM frame, then w1.isNearCM(w2)
380 // is exactly equivalent to w1.isNear(w2).
381 // If w1 and w2 have T components of zero, w1.isNear(w2) is exactly
382 // equivalent to w1.getV().isNear(w2.v()).
383
384 bool isParallel( const HepLorentzVector & w,
385 double epsilon=tolerance ) const;
386 // Test for isParallel is within tolerance epsilon
387 double howParallel (const HepLorentzVector & w) const;
388
389 static double getTolerance();
390 static double setTolerance( double tol );
391 // Set the tolerance for HepLorentzVectors to be considered near
392 // The same tolerance is used for determining isLightlike, and isParallel
393
394 double deltaR(const HepLorentzVector & v) const;
395 // sqrt ( (delta eta)^2 + (delta phi)^2 ) of space part
396
397// 4 - Intrinsic properties
398
399 double howLightlike() const;
400 // Close to zero for almost lightlike 4-vectors; up to 1.
401
402 inline double euclideanNorm2() const;
403 // Sum of the squares of time and space components; not Lorentz invariant.
404
405 inline double euclideanNorm() const;
406 // Length considering the metric as (+ + + +); not Lorentz invariant.
407
408
409// 4a - Relativistic kinematic properties
410
411// All Relativistic kinematic properties are independent of the sense of metric
412
413 inline double restMass2() const;
414 inline double invariantMass2() const;
415 // Rest mass squared -- same as m2()
416
417 inline double restMass() const;
418 inline double invariantMass() const;
419 // Same as m(). If m2() is negative then -sqrt(-m2()) is returned.
420
421// The following properties are rest-frame related,
422// and are applicable only to non-spacelike 4-vectors
423
424 HepLorentzVector rest4Vector() const;
425 // This 4-vector, boosted into its own rest frame: (0, 0, 0, m())
426 // The following relation holds by definition:
427 // w.rest4Vector().boost(w.boostVector()) == w
428
429 // Beta and gamma of the boost vector
430 double beta() const;
431 // Relativistic beta of the boost vector
432
433 double gamma() const;
434 // Relativistic gamma of the boost vector
435
436 inline double eta() const;
437 // Pseudorapidity (of the space part)
438
439 inline double eta(const Hep3Vector & ref) const;
440 // Pseudorapidity (of the space part) w.r.t. specified direction
441
442 double rapidity(const Hep3Vector & ref) const;
443 // Rapidity in specified direction
444
445 double coLinearRapidity() const;
446 // Rapidity, in the relativity textbook sense: atanh (|P|/E)
447
448 Hep3Vector findBoostToCM() const;
449 // Boost needed to get to center-of-mass frame:
450 // w.findBoostToCM() == - w.boostVector()
451 // w.boost(w.findBoostToCM()) == w.rest4Vector()
452
453 Hep3Vector findBoostToCM( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
454 // Boost needed to get to combined center-of-mass frame:
455 // w1.findBoostToCM(w2) == w2.findBoostToCM(w1)
456 // w.findBoostToCM(w) == w.findBoostToCM()
457
458 inline double et2(const Hep3Vector &) const;
459 // Transverse energy w.r.t. given axis squared.
460
461 inline double et(const Hep3Vector &) const;
462 // Transverse energy w.r.t. given axis.
463
464// 4b - Methods combining two 4-vectors
465
466 inline double diff2( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
467 // (this - w).dot(this-w); sign depends on metric choice
468
469 inline double delta2Euclidean ( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
470 // Euclidean norm of differnce: (delta_T)^2 + (delta_V)^2
471
472// 5 - Properties releative to z axis and to arbitrary directions
473
474 double plus( const Hep3Vector & ref ) const;
475 // t + projection in reference direction
476
477 double minus( const Hep3Vector & ref ) const;
478 // t - projection in reference direction
479
480// 7 - Rotations and boosts
481
482 HepLorentzVector & rotate ( const Hep3Vector & axis, double delta );
483 // Same as rotate (delta, axis)
484
485 HepLorentzVector & rotate ( const HepAxisAngle & ax );
486 HepLorentzVector & rotate ( const HepEulerAngles & e );
487 HepLorentzVector & rotate ( double phi,
488 double theta,
489 double psi );
490 // Rotate using these HepEuler angles - see Goldstein page 107 for conventions
491
492 HepLorentzVector & boost ( const Hep3Vector & axis, double beta );
493 // Normalizes the Hep3Vector to define a direction, and uses beta to
494 // define the magnitude of the boost.
495
496 friend HepLorentzVector rotationXOf
497 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double delta );
498 friend HepLorentzVector rotationYOf
499 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double delta );
500 friend HepLorentzVector rotationZOf
501 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double delta );
502 friend HepLorentzVector rotationOf
503 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const Hep3Vector & axis, double delta );
504 friend HepLorentzVector rotationOf
505 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const HepAxisAngle & ax );
506 friend HepLorentzVector rotationOf
507 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const HepEulerAngles & e );
508 friend HepLorentzVector rotationOf
509 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double phi,
510 double theta,
511 double psi );
512
513 inline friend HepLorentzVector boostXOf
514 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double beta );
515 inline friend HepLorentzVector boostYOf
516 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double beta );
517 inline friend HepLorentzVector boostZOf
518 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, double beta );
519 inline friend HepLorentzVector boostOf
520 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const Hep3Vector & betaVector );
521 inline friend HepLorentzVector boostOf
522 ( const HepLorentzVector & vec, const Hep3Vector & axis, double beta );
523
524private:
525
526 Hep3Vector pp;
527 double ee;
528
529 DLL_API static double tolerance;
530 DLL_API static double metric;
531
532}; // HepLorentzVector
533
534// 8 - Axial Unit 4-vectors
535
536static const HepLorentzVector X_HAT4 = HepLorentzVector( 1, 0, 0, 0 );
537static const HepLorentzVector Y_HAT4 = HepLorentzVector( 0, 1, 0, 0 );
538static const HepLorentzVector Z_HAT4 = HepLorentzVector( 0, 0, 1, 0 );
539static const HepLorentzVector T_HAT4 = HepLorentzVector( 0, 0, 0, 1 );
540
541// Global methods
542
543std::ostream & operator << (std::ostream &, const HepLorentzVector &);
544// Output to a stream.
545
546std::istream & operator >> (std::istream &, HepLorentzVector &);
547// Input from a stream.
548
549typedef HepLorentzVector HepLorentzVectorD;
550typedef HepLorentzVector HepLorentzVectorF;
551
552inline HepLorentzVector operator * (const HepLorentzVector &, double a);
553inline HepLorentzVector operator * (double a, const HepLorentzVector &);
554// Scaling LorentzVector with a real number
555
556 HepLorentzVector operator / (const HepLorentzVector &, double a);
557// Dividing LorentzVector by a real number
558
559// Tcomponent definition:
560
561// Signature protection for 4-vector constructors taking 4 components
562class Tcomponent {
563private:
564 double t_;
565public:
566 explicit Tcomponent(double t) : t_(t) {}
567 operator double() const { return t_; }
568}; // Tcomponent
569
570} // namespace CLHEP
571
572#include "CLHEP/Vector/LorentzVector.icc"
573
574#endif /* HEP_LORENTZVECTOR_H */
